contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Olympics Nicaragua |games=2004 Summer |competitors=5 (2 men, 3 women) |sports=3 |flagbearer=[[Svitlana Kashchenko]] |officials= }} '''[[Nicaragua]]''' competed at the '''[[2004 Summer Olympics]]''' in [[Athens]], [[Greece]]. ==Results by event== ===Athletics=== Neither Nicaraguan athlete advanced beyond the opening round of their respective events. '''[[Athletics at the 2004 Summer Olympics – Men's 100 metres|Men's 100 metres]]:''' * [[Carlos Abaunza]] **Heat: 11.17 s (8th in heat 9, did not advance, T-71st overall) '''[[Athletics at the 2004 Summer Olympics – Women's javelin throw|Women's Javelin Throw]]:''' * [[Dalila Rugama]] **Qualification: 51.42 m (19th in Group A, did not advance, 40th overall) ===Shooting=== [[Svitlana Kashchenko]] qualified for two events in Athens, but was unable to advance to a final in either one. '''[[Shooting at the 2004 Summer Olympics - Women's 50 metre rifle three positions|Women's 50 metre Rifle 3 Positions]]:''' * [[Svitlana Kashchenko]] **Qualification: 563 points (189 Prone, 183 Standing, 191 Kneeling, 28th overall, did not advance) '''[[Shooting at the 2004 Summer Olympics - Women's 10 metre air rifle|Women's 10 metre Air Rifle]]:''' * [[Svitlana Kashchenko]] **Qualification: 383 points (41st overall, did not advance) ===Swimming=== {{main|Swimming at the 2004 Summer Olympics}} {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" width="80%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Qualification !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="1"|Final !rowspan="2"|Rank |- !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time |- |[[Fernando Medrano-Medina]] |align=center|[[Swimming at the 2004 Summer Olympics – Men's 100 metre butterfly|Men's 100m Butterfly]] |align=center|1:00.91 |align=center|2 |align="center" colspan="3" |Did not advance |align=center|58 |- |[[Geraldine Arce]] |align=center|[[Swimming at the 2004 Summer Olympics – Women's 50 metre freestyle|Women's 50m Freestyle]] |align=center|28.73 |align=center|5 |align="center" colspan="3" |Did not advance |align=center|51 |} ==Officials== *President: Julio Rocha Lopez *Secretary General: Carlos Garcia Solorzano ==See also== *[[Nicaragua at the 2003 Pan American Games]] ==References== {{refbegin}} *[http://www.la84foundation.org/6oic/OfficialReports/2004/Results/ Official Report of the XXVIII Olympiad] *[http://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/countries/NCA/summer/2004/ sports-reference] {{refend}} {{Nations at the 2004 Summer Olympics}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Nicaragua At The 2004 Summer Olympics}} [[Category:Nations at the 2004 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Nicaragua at the Olympics|2004]] [[Category:2004 in Nicaragua|Olympics]] {{Nicaragua-sport-stub}} {{2004-Olympic-stub}}
